decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing / document title number(s):

Location Map; E01 (Existing Drawings Floor Plans); E02 (Existing Drawings Floor Plans); E03 (Existing Drawings Floor Plans); E04 (Existing Drawings Elevations); E05 (Existing Drawings Elevations); E06 (Existing Drawings Sections); E07 (Existing Drawings Section); P01 - Rev A (Proposed Drawings Floor Plans); P02 - Rev A (Proposed Drawings Floor Plans); P03 - Rev A (Proposed Drawings Elevations); P04 - Rev A (Proposed Drawings Elevation); P05 - Rev A (Proposed Drawings Elevation); P06 - Rev A (Proposed Drawings Section); P07 -  Rev A (Proposed Drawings Section); P08 - Rev A (Proposed Drawings Details); Fire Strategy (dated May 2024); Flood Statement (dated 8 May 2024)
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development hereby approved shall be as per those described in the submitted application form and plans listed in Condition 2.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023). | No part of the flat roofs of the proposed dwellinghouse shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof terrace/garden or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties and future occupiers of the development, in accordance with policies 7A ,7B and 7D of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013) and policies D4 and D6 of the London Plan (2021). | The site is within the worst mode aircraft 1-day noise contour predicted for 2016 (60dB) (See Appendix 5 SPG10). Before the development is commenced, details shall be submitted for approval by the Council in writing, for the sound insulation of the building envelope, based on the aircraft noise contour spectrum specified in Section 6 Supplementary Planning Guidance 10, and which will achieve the internal criteria for noise sensitive rooms. The details should also include the provision of alternative means of acoustically attenuated ventilation and cooling, as necessary, (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building and low self-noise), in accordance with the Council's criteria. The works should be completed before occupation and permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise in accordance with policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2023) and Ealing SPG10. | Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of enhanced sound insulation values of at least 5dB above the ADE Building Regulations values, for the floor/ceiling/wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses in adjoining dwellings/areas, namely, bedrooms below the kitchen, dining/ living/ bathroom of separate dwelling and of at least 10dB enhancement for the bedroom adjoining the main entrance and staircase of separate dwelling . Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), Standard 30 London Housing SPG 2016 and Policy D14 London Plan. | Control measures shall ensure that the following standards are implemented
- noise and vibration (according to Approved CoP BS 5228-1 and -2:2009+A1:2014),
- dust (according to Supplementary Planning Guidance by the GLA (2014) for The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition),
- lighting ('Guidance Note 01/20 For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light' by the Institution of Lighting Professionals),
- hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary restricted to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays, 0800 -1300 Saturdays,
- notifications of works to interested parties and regular neighbour liaison,
- public display of contact details including accessible phone numbers for persons responsible for the site works for the duration of the works.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, vibration, dust, lighting or other emissions from the site in accordance with policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2023) and Ealing SPG10. | The bicycle storage area identified in the approved drawings listed under condition 2 shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the hereby approved flats and shall be permanently retained for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: To provide adequate cycle storage facilities for future occupiers in accordance with policy T5 of the London Plan (2021). | The refuse and recycling storage area identified in the approved drawings listed under condition 2 shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the hereby approved flats and shall be permanently retained for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: To provide adequate refuse facilities for future occupiers in accordance with policy SI7 of the London Plan (2021) and Ealing Council Waste Management Guidelines for Architects and Developers. | CONDITION DELETED
description: Minor material amendment (S.73) to vary condition 10 (removal) pursuant to planning permission reference 241768FUL dated 09/07/2024 for: 'Conversion of existing dwellinghouse into 2 self-contained flats; and single storey rear extension.'
